thread.title: Intex Turbo Selfie+ and Ultra 4000i feature phones launched for Rs 1,490 and Rs 1,790 respectively
thread.title_full: Intex Turbo Selfie+ and Ultra 4000i feature phones launched for Rs 1,490 and Rs 1,790 respectively

title: Intex Turbo Selfie+ and Ultra 4000i feature phones launched for Rs 1,490 and Rs 1,790 respectively
text:
Intex Turbo Selfie+ and Ultra 4000i feature phones launched for Rs 1,490... Intex Turbo Selfie+ and Ultra 4000i feature phones launched for Rs 1,490 and Rs 1,790 respectively By - February 14, 2017 “The Turbo Selfie+ offers a front-facing camera, while the Ultra 4000i gets a beefy 4,000mAh battery” 
Soon after launching the budget VoLTE-enabled Aqua Lions 4G Android smartphone, Intex has added two new devices to its feature phones portfolio. The brand has launched the Intex Turbo Selfie+ and Ultra 4000i. As its name suggests, the former features a front-facing camera to let you capture selfies. The Ultra 4000i, on the other hand, is a battery-centric offering with a beefy 4,000mAh power cell. 
The Intex Turbo Selfie+ feature phone features a rear camera with an LED flash. It gets a 2.4-inch TFT display bearing a resolution of 240 x 320 pixels. It comes with wireless FM Radio, storage for 2,000 contacts and 200 SMSes, GPRS / WAP, an SOS button, expandable storage support up to 64GB and a 1,450mAh battery. 
The Intex Ultra 4000i flaunts a 4,000mAh battery, and can be used as a power bank to charge other devices. The device features a six-LED torch, a 2.8-inch TFT display, storage for 1,000 contacts and 200 SMSes, wireless FM, an SOS button and expandable storage up to 64GB. 
The Intex Turbo Selfie+ and Ultra 4000i also come with support for up to 22 regional languages. The former has been priced at Rs 1,490, while the latter will set you back by Rs 1,790. They will be available via brick and mortar stores in a single black hue. Facebook Comments
